title: what is wrong with the ping? do riot use different servers?
body:
Ok so heres the deal, i live in NL Canda, (East coast) and after the server move i always had a 67-72 ping, it would never change, recently this past month, i get 3 different ping averages, it is either 72, 85 or 98, it is consistent, there is no lag, it legit will stay as that all game, my internet is a 125 down/25 upload, and it is not just me, my step brother who has a different provider his ping is always the same difference, if it is 15 higher then avg mine is too.?
do riot use different servers, it is the only logical solution i have, some games have several servers, so am i connecting to servers further away? how do i fix this, this 98 ping is the death of me and super annoying to play on
its worth noting, that when it is like this i will do a speedtest while playing as i have two monitors, the internet chekcs out perfect, no packet loss no download or upload loss, and also i can jump into a game right after another and go from 98 back to 72, it makes no sense to me

replies.body:
That does seem like a pretty big ping difference.  For your specific issue, your ISP might be taking the scenic route (or the long way) to the game server, and may need to change the route the connection goes through.

Get a [traceroute](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) and submit a ticket to our [Player Support Team](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) who will be able to help you out.

I'm in Toronto and in the same timeframe my connection to riot servers has been unstable, while my normal average is 27 (which is a dream to play with) it has begun to spike to 200+ and while it corrects pretty fast it just goes up and down like that making the game pretty much unplayable. Everytime I see yet another post about this I throw my hat in the ring in hopes that there will be a real answer as to why, support is great if you make a ticket and I appreciate their help but the solution never lasts or is not a real solution because the problem is not with my connection I can ping to pretty much any other IP and get consistent results.
 If your connection is slower than before and is stable it is probably just going to stay that way, sorry be to the bringer of bad news but that happened to me and it only improved when the server moved to allow east coast to participate in LoL on the same level. my old 37 ping turned into a unsteady 90-120 which is basically a huge handicap you can't really play ranked. I would go through the Knowledge base though and see if the connection troubleshooter can bring you back into playable range there is a lot of good stuff there it is a long list but if you make it through without having some impact I would be amazed.

Im having almost the exact issue but im having a problem with loading screen, I crash in the loading screen making have to restart my client and reconnect I get in about 1:30 but its starting to get super annoying Iv had around 60-80 ping but now its 100-400 and at worst its goes to 5000 and I disconnect
I wish people would stop blaming the servers for their shitty internet connection/PCs.
